name: Veggie wholewheat pot noodle
description: This clever packed lunch is super healthy, with crisp vegetables, wholewheat noodles and a spicy, zingy dressing
keywords: 10-30 minutes, 2 of 5-a-day, 2 servings, 400 kcal or less, Chelsie Collins, Fibre, Folate, goodhealth, Healthy lunch, homemade pot noodle, noodle soup recipe, Packed lunch ideas, Vitamin c, Winter
recipeIngredients: 1 red pepper cut into fine strips
Â½ large courgette cut into matchsticks
1 carrot peeled and cut into matchsticks
2-4 tbsp crispy onions from a tub
1 red chilli deseeded and finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large saucepan with water and bring to the boil. Add the noodles and cook for 3-5 mins or until tender. Drain and leave to cool.

Place a large non-stick pan (or wok) over a medium-high heat and add the groundnut oil. When hot, add the red pepper and cook for 2-3 mins until slightly softened. Add the courgette and edamame, and cook for a further 1-2 mins. Remove from the heat, transfer to a bowl and allow to cool.
Whisk together the dressing ingredients in a small bowl, or 2 jars if taking to work, then season.
Divide the noodles between 2 jars or plastic containers and top with the cooled vegetables, beansprouts, carrot, spinach, crispy onions and coriander. Add the dressing just before eating.
